title: KKR Earnings Fall While Cash Available to Shareholders Hits New Heights
sub_head: The private-equity firm reported net income of $507.6 million in the final quarter of 2021 versus $1.48 billion a year earlier
body:
KKR & Co.â€™s fourth-quarter earnings fell as the change in the value of its investments lagged behind the broader market, while cash available to shareholders more than doubled to a fresh record.
The private-equity firm reported net income of $507.6 million, or 82 cents a share, in the final quarter of 2021, versus $1.48 billion, or $2.46 a share, a year earlier.
